Crimes.Crime_Name: Breach of consent requirements under PIPEDA
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant can claim damages under PIPEDA for unauthorized disclosure of personal information
Crimes.Governing_Law: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Application for damages in Federal Court following Privacy Commissioner investigation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Bank disclosed personal account information without consent; applicant concealed information during divorce
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove breach and resulting humiliation
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant's concealment of accounts reduced credibility and contributed to harm
Crimes.Legal_Rule: PIPEDA requires consent for disclosure of personal information; courts may award damages for humiliation under Section 16(c)
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness and correctness, depending on legal and factual issues
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Complaint first filed with Privacy Commissioner, then application made to Federal Court
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized disclosure of personal information by bank without consent
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim partially successful; breach confirmed but damages reduced due to contributory fault
Crimes.Judicial_Review_Outcome: Damages granted with reduction for contributory conduct
Crimes.Review_Standard: Correctness for legal questions, reasonableness for factual findings
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proper procedures followed: investigation by Privacy Commissioner, then court application
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Internal bank policies requiring consent, evidence of disclosure by employee, applicant’s concealment in divorce
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Establishing entitlement to damages despite own misconduct
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Acknowledged breach but argued applicant’s own actions contributed to harm
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, complaint report, internal bank records
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Monetary damages for humiliation and privacy breach
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Compensation for emotional distress and breach of privacy
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Individual applicant affected by data breach
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Complaint to Privacy Commissioner, then application to Federal Court for damages
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Damages awarded with mitigation due to applicant’s conduct
